project.summary: Alfresco is an open source, open-standards content repository built by the most experienced content management team that includes the co-founder of Documentum.

runProgram.progressText: Configure OpenOffice for the first time

directoryParameter.name: installdir
directoryParameter.explanation: Please specify the directory where ${product_fullname} will be installed

throwError.text: The path length seems larger than 92 characters. Correct this to avoid problems with OpenOffice, which is included in this installation.

passwordParameter.name: dbrootpasswd
passwordParameter.title: MySQL Password
passwordParameter.explanation: Initial password for the root and anonymous user accounts created during the MySQL database installation.

throwError.text: You need to provide a non-empty password

stringParameter.name: dbport
stringParameter.title: DB Port
stringParameter.explanation: Please enter the port for your MySQL database.

throwError.text: Unable to bind to the given port number. Please select another one.

stringParameter.name: tomcatport
stringParameter.title: HTTP Port
stringParameter.explanation: Please enter the port for your Tomcat HTTP server.

throwError.text: Unable to bind to the given port number. Please select another one.

stringParameter.name: tomcatshutdownport
stringParameter.title: Management Port
stringParameter.explanation: Please enter the port used for Tomcat Management.

throwError.text: Unable to bind to the given port number. Please select another one.

booleanParameter.name: installservice
booleanParameter.title: Install as a service
booleanParameter.explanation: You can optionally register ${product_fullname} as a service. This way it will automatically be started every time the machine is restarted. Install ${product_fullname} as a service?.

writeFile.text: @ECHO OFF REM Set Paths Utility SET JAVA_HOME=${installdir}\java SET OPENOFFICE_PATH=${installdir}\openoffice\openoffice\program

@echo off ${installdir.dos}\mysql\bin\mysql.exe --defaults-file="${installdir.dos}\mysql\my.ini" -u root < ${installdir.dos}\db_setup.sql ${installdir.dos}\mysql\bin\mysql.exe --defaults-file="${installdir.dos}\mysql\my.ini" -u root -e "UPDATE mysql.user SET Password=PASSWORD('%1') WHERE User='root';" ${installdir.dos}\mysql\bin\mysql.exe --defaults-file="${installdir.dos}\mysql\my.ini" -u root -e "UPDATE mysql.user SET Password=PASSWORD('%1') WHERE User='';" ${installdir.dos}\mysql\bin\mysql.exe --defaults-file="${installdir.dos}\mysql\my.ini" -u root -e "FLUSH PRIVILEGES;"
